instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Corrosion around smc and rtc area
threads.message:
Iâ€™m ordering 2 donor boards for this board that just arrived I tested cpu and It seems normal Reading .15v to ground as I remember from a previous board this should be ok. I uploaded the areas that have corrosion I will replace everything around cpu, rtc and smc. What would advice be as to what else you would replace
And just flux and reflow the rest

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Corrosion around smc and rtc area
threads.message: ALWAYS reball SMC, if you note corrosion close to it.
